Author: 田舎
Review: No matter when I go, the palms are beautiful and there are a lot of people, but the cherry blossoms were beautiful.

Author: Ma. Kristalyn Dimaguila
Review: Love it.

Author: 佐藤笑英
Review: good downtown. It's a little scary to go to the back at night. It is Kiyamachi Street.

Author: チャーハンぱんだ
Review: The Gion Festival must be seen from here. There are many people, but it is very powerful.

Author: ししまる
Review: nan

Author: me windowsi
Review: It is a road with two lanes on each side with a lot of traffic and many buses and taxis. It is a road where Hankyu and subway lines pass below. However, there were many cars with bad manners, and there were quite a few illegally parked cars. Besides, there was a lot of traffic, so I think it would be the worst if I drove on the road. .

Author: ただの通りすがり
Review: When going north from Kyoto Station by bus, the flow of buses was often delayed by cars waiting for parking near Matsubara in front of Shijo Kawaramachi. Are you considering any countermeasures?

Author: arul raj
Review:
Pretty good place for a walking roaming over and I can see a lot of foreigners very busy street pretty good to roam around
Must see places in Kyoto problems too far away from the Kyoto mainstation

Author: TOMO M
Review:
On Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays, the sidewalks and roads are very crowded.
Lines for buses, people in front of shops, passers-by fill the sidewalks. The roads are also crowded with regular cars and buses, and the buses are almost always late, and the inside of the car is also quite crowded.
I feel that it is over capacity.

Author: 上垣大介
Review:
Is the ground okay? .
Also, I can see the faces of the people of Kyoto, who are indebted to Osaka and are angry and angry.

Author: Anze Hao
Review: One if the main shopping streets with great public transportation access

Author: 歳常文夫
Review: Parking Lot,. . expensive

Author: るか
Review: There are a lot of people, but I feel like I've come to Kyoto, and I really like it.

Author: Davide Guerzoni
Review: Very peaceful place. Must see

Author: Anderson Hsieh
Review: Interesting temple hiding in an ally. Not big but quit cozy and relaxing.

Author: Lorenzo Pirisino
Review: Great stop when in central Kyoto, especially if on a tourist trip and with little time to see the other major attractions. The temple is well kept and it's nested in a group of buildings that surround it.

Author: Trans-word plus TGM
Review: Rokkakudo : In the middle of bustling street near Karasuma Oike ( central part of Kyoto ) there is a temple with hexagonal shape. This is a Buddhist temple Chouhouji known as Rokkakudo for its hexagonal shape of the main temple.  An ancient book says that this temple was founded in 587 by Prince Shotoku. ( Trans-word+ : TGM Kyoto Guide )

Author: Wasif Mirza
Review: Nice tranquil temple in the middle of a bustling street.

Author: pauline beegan
Review: Rokkakudo is a beautiful temple but somehow the Buddhist values in relation to their decorative birds are lost.The swans are kept in very poor conditions. The area that they swim in is very small and cramped. they cannot walk around or get out of the water.One is in very obvious distress.There are also caged birds as decoration on a wall. I talked to the monks about this being at odds with the Buddhist tenet of causes of suffering. I would like to see the swans released to the river where they would have freedom.

Author: Wing L
Review: This is the second time that I have visited this temple. It's small, but very clean. It smells like incense inside. There are not that many tourists when I was there the second time. But I remember it being way more crowded the first time (in 2015). There is no entrance fee, so that's great! The location is also very convenient!

Author: Michael Hobbs
Review: It almost seems easy to overlook, but once you actually peek in the gate, you'll find a beautiful and serene temple.

Author: Brett
Review: One of the better temples in Kyoto. Secluded but not a far walk from Nishiki

Author: chen tom (tom chen toys)
Review: Beautiful small temple in the downtown

Author: Panithan P
Review: nice old temple

Author: dorango27172
Review: Wonderful!!

Author: Andrea Cosimo
Review: Center of Ikebana.

Author: Ian Gore
Review: Cool lantern, would thought they would have mie ikebana merch around but still a fun place and a visit for those in the next door building.

Author: Benny Shih
Review: Peaceful temple

Author: Ken Magi
Review: Amazing deportment store with a lot of high end brands.  Food floor alone is worth grazing on the unique baked goods ☺

Author: 조윤석
Review:
good to eung-ga due to bide.
But, toilet is small size compared to lotte department store

Author: Daling Sheng
Review: Quite excited seeing this shopping center again! It has been moving out of Singapore for ages! The closing time is quite early in Japan (8pm) we don't have a chance to shop inside the mall.

Author: P. Handoko
Review:
Wonderful food alley at the basement.

One is sure to find something to his/her liking by walking through this level.

Author: I Kay
Review: Really nice mall, but I recommend checking out the basement level. Their food options are incredible and worth the trip!

Author: Ángel Galdón Rodríguez
Review: Nice variety for general shopping. It's got a currency exchange machine on the seventh floors, although rates aren't amazing.

Author: Nicole Lavelle
Review: Beautiful experience especially the home goods zone. Cool food court in basement. Bathrooms on every floor!

Author: Josef Vincent Caneba
Review: The basement level is full of food on sale during the evenings. A lot of choices for a reasonable cost

Author: Will Park
Review: Amazing food court in the basement. Go there and eat your way out

Author: Daniel Chang
Review: I was always passing by here on my way to work. There is a tea shop on the bottom floor and the food section is interesting. As with most large department stores in Japan, prices are higher but then quality is too for the most part.

Author: Simon Leung
Review: Some good shops.

Author: ken miya
Review: There are many shops selling miscellaneous goods. On the other hand, there are not many restaurants.

Author: Z O
Review: A shopping street with a north-south roof from Shijo to Sanjo. There are many movie theaters in this street.

Author: 簡綺真
Review: It’s easy to shop, buy and eat delicious food. It’s the busiest business district in Kyoto. There are Takashimaya Department Store and 0101 nearby. There are also many local souvenirs

Author: P C
Review: There are a lot of shops, a very prosperous commercial area, and because there are sunshade roof joints between the buildings, even in the hot summer...the air conditioners in each open store make the shopping street very cool! On rainy days, you can go shopping without an umbrella!

Author: Yuan Wang
Review: The shopping street with a canopy is very special, and it is cool and comfortable for shopping. Unfortunately, the stores are too repetitive and there are many souvenir shops, but it is not recommended to buy souvenirs or souvenirs here. Most of the workmanship is rough and expensive. Some makeup is cheaper than Osaka

Author: aco wang
Review:
- Very long shopping street, there are still some shops open until 11 and 12 o'clock
- There is also a link to Nishiki Market where you can visit!

Author: 홍조
Review: It is an arcade style shopping street. There's nothing special about it, but there are small but anime specialty stores like Toranoana and Gamers. If you want to virtuous in Kyoto, you should come here.

Author: W. G
Review: This market is just so vibrant and sells variety of things. You should try the furikake and mochi here.

Author: 身心流創始喬安
Review: It's fun to visit and the owls can get close

Author: Yogesh Desai
Review: Nice shopping

Author: Chou Meizai (粗眉仔)
Review:
Nishiki Tenmangu is connected to the shopping street Xinjingji Street. Like the Nishiki Market, this street is also covered with tiles, so it is not afraid of the sun and rain.
There is 24-hour Wi-Fi in the shopping street, but I have never tried it, so I don’t know if the speed is fast. If you have used it, please tell me.
Unlike Tongjin Market, this street is mostly shops selling dry goods such as clothes, shoes and socks. Because it is still early, many shops are not open yet.

Author: 黃瀚霆（KaiChia KaiChia）
Review: better than ichlan!

Author: とうや
Review: A large shopping street that can be enjoyed just by walking, and there are only paid parking lots in the surrounding area, so public transportation is recommended. Recently, there are many foreigners. There are shops even in a little back street, and you can enjoy exploring.

Author: Howford Li
Review: Spectacular shopping mall with lots of good stuff at reasonable prices. I got my mate a pair of really nice converse for ¥8100 at ABC-mart grand stage. The fashion stores are nice and there are plenty of stores, there is bound to be something for anyone and everyone to see!

Author: Shingo Sae-Lim
Review:
(Trip was made back then on 30 Nov 2019, 2 years before the Covid-19 Pandemic hit)

Our first stop was Nishikori Market Shopping Street upon reaching Kyoto in the early morning 2 years ago on this very day.

The market caters to both locals and tourists, offering a wide variety of goods for sale, ranging from street food snacks, to merchandise and eateries, as well as fresh seafood and preserved vegetables.

There were so many choices but we decided to only try a few and save room for lunch. The street food snacks ranged from decent to tasty, but nothing was really an attention grabber.

During pre-Covid-19 times, manoeuvring down the street proved to be challenging due to the large crowd of people being crammed into a narrow street.

It’s an interesting place to visit as a first timer but Kyoto has many more interesting attractions and Nishiki lacks the attractiveness to entice us to revisit anytime soon.

Author: Christoph Wirths
Review:
There’s just so much to see and sample in Nishiki Market. Everywhere you turn there’s something delicious.
We had a tamago sandwich that was made in a shop that sold mainly eggs and the sandwiches, it was amazing. The market is kept clean and although it is a tourist spot, when you go early in the morning it’s a really nice experience. You can buy anything from coffee to sushi. This place has got it all!>?

Author: J J Activezone
Review: If you are in Kyoto I strongly reslcceoend to visit that market! There are few parts. Specially interesting is part with food which is Nishiki Market itself. You can find a lot of interesting dishes and food here. Do not be affraid and try! Everything is fresh. There are shops with nice souvenires, tea, porcelain and regular shops with clothes.

Author: putu ardha
Review: This place is shopping heaven and cheap food ! Must try if you planning to go to kyoto . I suggest come with a lot of cash , you will try any food that they offer in this isle . It’s not even holiday season yet but it’s already this busy !

Author: Johnny Trinh
Review:
Good food, the prices are relatively decent (compared to other markets). I had the chance to try many things, from skewers to tempura, from honey-based drinks to mochi desserts.

I recommend people to go there. Also, the samurai and ninja museum is located inside. I also recommend. It's a nice experience. Book on their website and in advance for a discounted price.

Author: Kian Mohtachem
Review: Of course partly targeting tourists but great diversity of food nonetheless. Definitely worth a visit.

Author: Chong Tee Lim
Review: Local Japanese Market in Japan with lots of local Japanese cuisines including takotamogo, the original matcha drinks, tempuras, soya milk latte, sashimi, local giftshops more! Good place for souvenirs also

Author: Ting Ting
Review:
Nishiki market is a great choice when you plan your trip to Kyoto. By visiting the Nishiki market, tourists will be able to get the idea and understand the local flavor and culture of Japanese. On the other hand, the market has good varieties of locally produced dried foods and it is a great place to shop for food souvenirs!

Nishiki Market is very clean and the products are neatly arranged. Most of the products sold are locally produced and the market offers very fresh seafood. Visitors could easily spend an hour or more at Nishiki Market which has more than one hundred shops and restaurants. I enjoyed the atmosphere of the market and the sellers were very friendly and approachable.

Author: Engo Po
Review: One of the best markets I ever visited in Japan.  Tourist friendly and yet not ‘tourist targeted only’.  Products with wide variety with decent price.

Author: Helen Aivazian
Review: What an experience - on all your senses! So many good options and lots of lovely little stores to look in too. Very busy as expected.

Author: Ro Newcombe
Review: There are plenty of shops to explore. If you’re looking for souvenirs or interesting food experiences, this market is perfect. As with many touristy spots, it gets busy very quickly, especially on the weekends. Go before noon if you want to avoid crowds~

Author: Tasha Yogiswara
Review:
I could spend hours here! From snacks, food, drinks (sake, anyone?), to souvenirs, you can find everything here.

It can get really crowded, but you can always find a place to eat as there are plenty of choices 🤤

Author: Riku
Review: It is one of the best places to eat and shopping in rainy days of Kyoto. The street is narrow, but fully covered making it easy to walk between blocks to explore local food and souvenirs.

Author: Ivo Meixner
Review: If you want to try some local food made by local stores rather than big chains, then this is not a bad choice for a place to visit. However, there are also countless big brand stores if you want to do more regular shopping, or you can visit the local Kura-Sushi, for example. In general, there are countless options in terms of restaurants and various stores with more than just food. The place itself is also rather spectacular. Just beware of huge, dense crowds of tourists, which tend to form here and can be very hard to move through.

Author: Sara Pierson
Review: Very interesting culinary experience! Stop by any of the small restaurants for a beer and a snack. Lots of nice shops to look through as well. Great for a rainy afternoon as it's all covered.

Author: Martin Reindl
Review: Nice little temple at the end of Nishiki market. Worth a quick stop if you're walking down the market street.

Author: Peter Bury
Review: Beautiful little shrine that comes as a bit of a surprise as it's right in the middle of the shopping district.

Author: Takuya Hakoda
Review: The both edges of "Torii" are pushing the walls of both side.

Author: sandeep subedi
Review: cool temple inside, outside  croudy street

Author: Rio Rinaldo
Review: Small little shrine at the end of Nikishi market. There's a bull statue at the entrance and I saw people rubbing its forehead, supposedly for good luck. Nothing wrong to try.

Author: HJ L
Review: Small shirine nearby nishiki market.

Author: KO KO
Review: Interesting shrine, in the middle of the market you can find here. I wished more smarter.

Author: A C
Review: It was a rainy winter morning when we spotted it tucked between some modern buildings at the end of Nishiki market, and decided to pop in. Small, scenic and lovely, not many people at the time. We did the water ladle ritual. Great for a quick respite from all the bustle just outside.

Author: Shira S
Review: Nice small temple which you can visit on your journey through the Nishiki market

Author: Alex Ang
Review:
The location of the temple itself is a spectacular view, the temple fit in nicely in the middle of a busy shopping street.
It is small buy full of surprises.

Author: Lazy Cat
Review: Small, very nice temple

Author: Paul Gent
Review: Nice temple at the end of the market.  They have the ink stamp if you are collecting them.

Author: Peder Van Loewe
Review: A little peace in amongst the hustle n bustle of japanese life

Author: Alvin Liu
Review: A very small temple near the market.

Author: John C
Review: Wonderful temple.

Author: Dennis Quah
Review: A classic in Japan. The Kyoto store is now a little tired looking, especially in the upper floors.

Author: Stephen Abraham
Review: Probably my favorite shopping mall in Kyoto. 8 floors of shopping goodness. From men's wear, to electrical appliances and to food. My favorite attraction is the food supermarket at the lower ground floor. The spread of food is just amazing. And come towards 9pm, where everyone tries to push and finish selling their produce. It's like a food market. At the food market you can get fresh sushi, sashimi, bento sets, cakes, deserts, and much more. Located just above the Kawaramachi station. This place is highly recommended if you are in Kyoto.

Author: Aruno Amuri
Review: Great shopping mall and now there's a Pokemon Center !

Author: Jason Maynard
Review: Lovely department store with plenty of western brands as well as Japanese ones. You'll get greeted constantly as you walk through sections, but the staff are very friendly. Some decent variety of items, but few are inexpensive. Just wish there was more choices of Japan items. Loved finding some Japanese designers' works, and my kids liked going through the Japanese cosmetics.

Author: ELEL LI
Review: Very good

Author: Ariel Angel
Review: The basement is filled with delicious goods, from all over Japan and from the west as well

Author: Evan PW
Review: A massive, very clean and very upscale department store. The staff are also extremely helpful. We made the mistake, however, of thinking this would be something like the average department store in the West, with some budget options for simple items. We could not find a pillow for less than $150 CAD, or a pair of shorts for less than $80 CAD. A great place to shop if you are wealthy, or looking to splurge on some high end items.

Author: Kato Sara
Review: Tourists are able to get a 5% coupon on top of tax free

Author: Kim H
Review: I came here for the Pokemon Centre, but it is otherwise a huge, nice, upscale department store.

Author: Lynn S
Review: A well-known Japanese department store with a wide selection of goods. Visitors can sign up for a 10% discount card (does not apply to already reduced items) and you can take care of your tax-free shopping refund at their customer service center.  They can give you your refund immediately in cash for a small fee (probably worth the time savings unless you made really large purchases).

Author: E C
Review: While it's a pretty interesting high-end Japanese department store, the real gem here is the Kyoto Pokémon Center, which is located on the children's floor.  There were tons of tourists there, so it's a bit of a hot spot.  They have all sorts of really cool Pokémon goods, and some items unique to this specific store.  I bought a set of Hanafuda Cards that are a mash up of Pokémon, and Mario.

Author: Christina Bellucci
Review: Beautiful department store, with amazing selection of crockery and kitchen tools. Staff didn't speak English but did their best to help me select a tamago-making pan, and cooking chopsticks. Also, the restaurant floor offers a great selection of cuisines. The sushi lunch was delicious, even the green tea icecream!

Author: jay pachchigar
Review: Good shopping centre with great food department on the lower floor.

Author: Melanie Byford (Mylan)
Review: Nice little Pokemon center shop

Author: Courtenay Beasley
Review: Great dept store! Pokemon centre inside os awesome!

Author: Peter Kontogeorgis
Review: Really quite dated when compared to other department stores in Japan. The eighth floor restaurants are also looking quite stale and dated. Most places seem to be serving similar food. They do have Baby seats however so that's one positive and the main reason we are here.

Author: Kam Hoe Chaw (Super Good)
Review: A shopping mall with almot everything you need. Fashions and cloths. And underground shopping with both raw and cook food. And Good place to grab a gift.
